subtitles_text: >> JEFF: Previously on Survivor:
Three days before the merge, Kucha had a one-member advantage
over Ogakor. >> NICK: It's a huge advantage,
because the pressure is on them to win the next challenge.
>> JEFF: And it looked like they might regain their winning
streak when Nick led them to victory in the reward challenge.
>> NICK: We are a very cocky group.
It's fun to have them talk about how hungry they are, and us
going there and win all their food.
>> JEFF: Ogakor couldn't hide their frustration.
>> JERRI: The other tribe will probably just pick us off one by
one. >> JEFF: But before the immunity
challenge could take place, the game took a violent twist,
Michael passed out in the fire, and was severely burned.
>> ( Michael groaning ) >> MICHAEL: Kucha, you guys
know what to do. >> JERRI: There has been an
accident at the Kucha camp, and one of their members has been
evacuated. >> JEFF: Michael's evacuation
leaves Kucha and Ogakor even, with five members each.
Tonight, will new strategies and new friendships be born as the
two tribes merge into one? Who will be the first person
voted out of the new tribe? >> They've been handed a gift.
They are going into this with an advantage, because we were
supposed to be one up on them anyway.
They were about to be voted off one by one, and they know it.
>> JEFF V.: For the last three weeks, we've been competing with
another tribe. At this point we get down to ten
total people, and we come together and merge into one
tribe. >> KIMMI: It blows my mind to
even picture any sort of loyalty toward...
I don't even know them. We have been through so much
together. >> JEFF V.: We've talked about
strategy and how we were going to merge with this other team
ever since Mike got hurt, because the last thing that he
said to us as he left was that somebody from Kucha needs to
take this money. And regardless of what happens,
we need to eat 'em up and spit 'em out.
>> ALICIA: This is going to have to get ugly if we really want
this thing to work. >> The first vote, we have to do
something to get an advantage. >> NICK: It's going to depend on
that first vote, and it's smooth sailing from there.
>> You hit it on the head, son. >> ELISABETH: If I had to vote
right now, I'd vote Colby, and I'd vote Jerri next.
>> ALICIA: It's got to be Jerri and Colby first.
>> JEFF V.: My instinct says Tina was the guiding force.
When I was standing in that number one circle and I was
quizzing her, and the way she was answering my questions just
told me that she was putting on a face, and was a shrewd woman.
>> JEFF V.: We were just trying to figure out who probably is
Ogakor's weak link, and maybe we can convince them to come over
and vote on our side. >> ALICIA: Tina will not turn on
her team. >> JEFF V.: No, I know Tina
won't turn. >> ALICIA: There's no way.
>> Most likely to turn is Keith. >> Keith and Amber.
>> ALICIA: I just think Nick and I are going to have to be ready
for anything 'cause he and I are going to be the first ones.
>> KIMMI: See, I think they'll be gunnin' for me.
>> JEFF V.: Listen to you all talking.
It's me. Plus, Kimmi on the first reward
challenge. They asked who Debb voted for,
and Kimmi said Jeff, so they know that I have a vote against
me. We're anticipating a five to
five tie in the first vote. And in the rules, when there's a
deadlock tie, the person with the most votes accumulated to
that point is the one to leave. >> NICK: I had totally forgotten
about that. >> JEFF V.: It's never left my
mind. >> RODGER: If they remember
that... >> JEFF V.: But then again,
that's a vote against me, so it wouldn't leave my mind.
( laughter ) >> ELISABETH: What happens then?
>> I would be, like, forget about it.
>> COLBY: Yesterday everything was canceled because of the
accident with Kucha. You know, you're just left with
days that seem like there's at least 19 to 20 hours of
daylight. We have no idea what's going
on, and we have no idea how drastic or serious the situation
is with Kucha. >> TINA: It's so unfortunate.
>> COLBY: Automatically, we assume the worst... horrible.
The worst part about this is waiting around for information.
>> TINA: It's like getting a phone call from the hospital,
saying, "Oh, we've got him here, but can't tell you what's
wrong." >> JERRI: You don't think Rodger
had a stroke or anything? ( Tina gasps dramatically )
>> TINA: Oh, my gosh. >> COLBY: We don't know
anything. We don't know when we're
merging, we don't know the condition of Kucha's member
who's been in an accident. We don't know very much at all.
>> AMBER: "Boys night out." >> COLBY: Well?
>> AMBER: It's different. >> AMBER: "You've wondered for
weeks 'What's their camp like?' So, here's your big chance.
Send your scouts for the hike. The men will visit while the
women remain. Cook a big dinner,
there'll be guests to entertain."
So, we'll stay here and the guys are going to come to our camp,
we'll cook dinner for them, they're going to cook for you
guys. >> COLBY: Cool.
So, we get to go on a hike. >> KEITH: I'm all over that.
>> COLBY: Yeah! Finally get out and do
something. I better iron a shirt!
( laughing ) Big night out on the town,
brother. >> KEITH: Big night, you know?
( indistinct conversations ) Life is good.
>> COLBY: Life is good. >> KEITH: The merge is when the
two teams come together to make one team, and the game becomes
one against one instead of team against team.
>> COLBY: Tina, you going to catch the kids some fish
tonight? >> TINA: I hope.
You go to one camp or the other, and I'm not sure how that
decision is going to be made at this point.
>> KEITH: We'll get a real great take on the guys in their tribe,
and where things lie. >> TINA: It's important for us
to get information right now about who's had votes cast
against them, because it's probably going to come down to a
tie-breaker vote. >> COLBY: We've got to be
totally silent on who's had any votes.
>> JERRI: Yes, we do have a lot at stake.
If we slip anything out regarding the voting situation,
we're done. The only thing to break the tie
is past votes for the person who is voted for.
If they were to vote for myself or Keith... we'd be out.
>> ELISABETH: Hey, fellas, are you guys ready to hear this?
We got mail. "Girls' night out.
You've wondered for weeks 'What's their camp like?'
So here's your big chance. Send your scouts for the hike.
The women will go visit, while the fellows remain.
Cook a big dinner, there'll be guests to entertain."
>> JEFF V.: So, you guys are going over there, and those
girls are coming over here. They're keeping the chicks
apart. >> ELISABETH: They're going to
send their chicks here? >> ALICIA: Oh, that's sneaky.
>> ELISABETH: That is very sneaky.
>> ALICIA: That is very sneaky. This is how it's going to
start-- separate the boys and the girls.
>> JEFF V.: We knew that the merger was going to start today.
We just weren't sure exactly how.
So, we got this note, and our girls are going to them, and
their chicks are coming to us, and we're entertaining them and
swooning them and somehow convincing them that this is the
place to live-- Kucha beach. >> ALICIA: We know we don't want
to go over there, so they better really pull out all the stops.
>> NICK: I think we have a really nice camp, and nobody
really wants to move to a new place where things are real
strange. And it would kind of be our home
field, our home turf advantage. >> JEFF V.: If we're responsible
for the dinner, then those girls are eating much better than
y'all are. >> ALICIA: Wait a minute.
( all talking ) >> ALICIA: Wait, time out.
>> ELISABETH: Women will go visit.
>> ALICIA: Do we have the Mountain Dew at least?
>> MEN: No! >> ELISABETH: You have two cans
left? >> ALICIA: You see how fast you
guys turned on us? >> ELISABETH: We have to bring a
housewarming gift. >> NICK: We're not turning on
you. >> JEFF V.: Nobody's turning on
nobody. >> RODGER: We need our own
stuff. >> JEFF V.: We got the majority
of them over here. >> NICK: There's more of them to
woo. We need to woo them.
>> ELISABETH: Woo-woo-woo, "woo them"?
>> ALICIA: You know what? I don't like you guys anymore.
>> ELISABETH: This is why they did this to us.
As much as it stinks that Alicia and I aren't going to get to
join in our last chicken, we know that it's for the
betterment of the whole group to leave and go eat plain rice with
Keith and Colby. He's supposedly a chef.
I don't know how much he can do with white rice, and...
We're going to miss our Kucha spices.
>> ALICIA: Yeah, we had a lot of good stuff going on in our camp.
Those girls are going to be well taken care of.
>> ELISABETH: Living large. Whoo!
>> ALICIA: Elisabeth and I felt really strange walking away from
camp, just us two. It was really kind of cool,
and eventually it's going to change this game.
It's a big open book, and we got to write the rest of the pages
that go in it. >> COLBY: I'm very curious as to
how they've been living the last 19 days.
With their shelter, with their eating, you know, there's a lot
of things I want to know to see if that's where we want to be.
>> ELISABETH: I'm excited. I'm so curious to see what their
camp is like. >> ALICIA: Well, that's the
thing... And how they set it up for us.
>> TINA: Fe, fi, fo, fum! I smell the blood of a Kucha
girl! >> ALICIA: What's up?
>> ELISABETH: Hey! >> ALICIA: What's up?
You know how funny it is-- the guys are expecting you guys
right now. ( laughter )
>> ALICIA: We had... laying out the tablecloth.
>> It said "Boys Night Out." >> ALICIA: They're so ready.
They're going to die when they see your guys.
>> TINA: We've been so worried. >> ELISABETH: They didn't even
tell you guys what happened? >> TINA: No, not a word.
>> ALICIA: What did your note say?
>> AMBER: Somebody got hurt and they would not be returning.
>> TINA: And they've been evacuated out.
>> ELISABETH: Sit down for this one.
>> ALICIA: Yeah, this is a, it's a big deal.
>> ELISABETH: It was good to hear that they were worried and
hoping everything and praying everything was okay with Mike.
He apparently just hyperventilated and passed out.
And all of a sudden, I see him down and he was face-first into
the fire. >> ALICIA: His hands were burned
off. When his hands were in the
water, the skin was floating up above his hand.
>> ELISABETH: They were just red.
>> ALICIA: They put a helicopter right on our beach and took him
away. >> TINA: Have you heard any news
on him at all? >> ALICIA: Yeah, he's going to
be okay. >> TINA: Glad to know it's not
one of those things that's life- threatening.
I felt a lot of relief. >> ALICIA: We were crying, we
were a mess. It was really sad.
>> ELISABETH: It was very difficult.
>> JERRI: When we first found out yesterday that we were
merging with all five of us, after the accident over at
Kucha... we didn't really know whether to celebrate or feel
bad. >> ALICIA: Whatever takes you
out of the game takes you out of the game.
Whether it's a snake bite or the fire, it was part of the game.
And he is the sixth person to leave.
>> TINA: The importance at this point in at five and five, had a
huge impact on the other four tribes, if we had gone in at six
and four, we would have been picked off one by one, no doubt
about it. We're starting off the second
half of the game on equal ground.
It's a tie ball game, we're going into overtime.
>> COLBY: We got to be getting close. Look at this.
Anybody home? >> KEITH: Knock-knock.
Hola. >> JEFF V.: What?
Wait a minute! >> COLBY: What are you guys
doing? Well, we took a little trip down
the beach. >> KEITH: Hi, man!
>> NICK: Good to see you. >> JEFF V.: So, your note said
what, "Boys Night Out"? >> COLBY: "Boys Night Out."
>> JEFF V.: Ours said "Girls Night Out."
>> RODGER: We were expecting the women over here.
>> COLBY: Rodger, I'm real sorry, bro.
I didn't even bring a skirt with me, so I can't do anything for
you, man. >> COLBY: When Keith and I
showed up, they couldn't have been more disappointed.
They were ready to wine and dine the women of Ogakor, and Keith
and I come strolling in. Look, you guys already had the
table set and everything. Y'all really were expecting
the... ( all talking and laughing )
>> KEITH: Colby and I were actually kind of hoping it was
going to be the girls cooking for the guys.
We had a good time, great camaraderie, kind of like
soldiers in the field that are putting their weapons down for
awhile. >> COLBY: Well, now, you guys
called this Camp Carnage, but it looks like you guys are living
pretty plush around here. Our girls, when they sent us
off, they're like, "Man, check out their camp-- if it's
smelling and there's flies, I don't want to move over there."
( laughter ) >> JEFF V.: All I saw from Colby
were teeth-- big smile, how's it going, whatever.
He just seemed very cheery and very happy, and Keith seemed
like a little puppy tailing behind him.
We saved a chicken for you. >> KEITH: Are you serious?
>> RODGER: Yeah, we're going to have chicken tonight.
>> KEITH: You guys are too much. >> JEFF V.: We got spices, too.
>> KEITH: We can roast it in paper bark.
Wrap that whole thing in there, put the spices on and slow roast
that. They saved a chicken for us.
They killed their last chicken and cooked it, which just was a
real gentleman thing to do for us.
>> JEFF V.: You know, there's a Survivor twist to everything,
and they got us again. I was expecting women, you know.
We were going to lather them up and go pick them flowers, and
now we're going to have to shift gears.
( laughing ) They're nice, you know?
They're nice guys. I knew they would be, but I get
the feeling that Keith is an outsider.
So far, they're exactly what I expected.
They seem to have a good relationship together, which I
didn't expect. I figured that Keith would sort
of be off on his own, and he could be, you know?
They may be working us here. Just pick one up, take a bite,
pass it. >> COLBY: I didn't think I'd see
chicken across these lips for 24 days.
That lemon pepper is the bomb. >> JEFF V.: It was good chicken,
and it was good to be able to provide them with chicken,
'cause they obviously had not been eating.
>> KEITH: Colby, what do you want me to do with this bone,
man? I don't like the way we're
passing. Can we change the passing
around? Can we go the other way?
That was a huge thing for us. We really enjoyed that a lot.
I think as the days go on, this game is going to be difficult.
It is for me personally, 'cause I get caught up in the
friendship thing quite easily. >> RODGER: Even though it was
little tough, that was still a good chicken.
>> KEITH: Yeah. >> COLBY: It was an excellent
chicken. >> RODGER: I know everybody is
nicey-nicey now, but I imagine that'll change.
I think it will be even more interesting once all ten of us,
the women and everybody is in the hut.
There'll be some times I'm sure when things won't be so nice
around here. >> ELISABETH: You need some
help? >> JERRI: I think I'll be all
right. I'm just trying to cover this,
'cause you know what I just realized?
Our only matches are in Keith's pocket.
>> ALICIA: Uh-oh. >> JERRI: Yeah, "uh-oh" is
right. So, I'm thinking we should
probably cook everything because Keith has the matches.
>> ALICIA: Are you sure he has them?
>> JERRI: I know he does. >> ALICIA: He's probably
laughing right now, going "Guess what?
It's raining and I got the matches."
>> JERRI: He doesn't realize it, I'm sure.
I don't want to talk about Keith in front of our guests.
>> ALICIA: Smell that. >> JERRI: If I voice my opinions
about how I really feel about him, they are going to figure
out that votes have been placed against him.
He should not be in charge of the matches.
Could have potentially now been an issue where we couldn't eat.
>> TINA: I don't think it was a deliberate thing where he said,
"I'm going to take my matches with me so the girls won't have
it." He would not do that under any
circumstances. It's in Jerri's best interest to
not to show a real hateful side. Jerri's a good chick.
>> JERRI: Normally it looks a lots better than it is right
now. >> ELISABETH: We're going home.
( laughter ) >> JERRI: We decided that I was
going to make my famous tortilla, and we opened a can of
whole peeled tomatoes. >> ALICIA: We just want to tell
you guys that your guys are getting chicken right now.
>> AMBER: Oh! There's no way they saved any
for us. >> ALICIA: They're getting
chicken right now. >> AMBER: I'm sorry we don't
have any chicken. >> ALICIA: That's okay.
>> AMBER: This is definitely difficult for us.
I mean, we wish we had so much more to offer them.
It's upsetting that we can't give them as much as they can
give us. >> ALICIA: Wow, that looks
amazing, though. >> JERRI: Give me, like, some
ingredients that I can get creative with.
>> ALICIA: When you don't have a lot of food and you open up a
can, that's like... that's big- time.
So, we're really honored that they did that.
>> AMBER: Watch it, it's hot. >> ALICIA: I feel like I can't
wait to get them back to our camp to give them something to
eat, you know? And I never thought that I would
feel that way. I really thought I would be
thinking I'm not sharing anything with them.
I don't eat meat, I don't eat pork, and I'm, like, craving a
hot dog and a hamburger; I could care less right now.
>> JERRI: I would love a hot dog.
( laughing ) >> ALICIA: Out of 20 hours of
being here, we've talked about food 19 of those 20.
So, what's your favorite kind of food?
>> JERRI: Hot fudge. >> TINA: How about Dove
chocolate? ( everyone groaning )
>> ELISABETH: We're torturing ourselves.
We are absolutely torturing ourselves.
>> ALICIA: Have you ever had different flavor Tootsie Rolls,
like cherry Tootsie Rolls? >> TINA: Yes.
>> JERRI: Vanilla? >> ALICIA: They are yummy.
>> JERRI: When did they come out with vanilla Tootsie Rolls?
>> AMBER: I asked Alicia about their firewood situation.
She said they have so, so much, they don't worry about the
firewood at all. >> JERRI: They have a kitchen,
they have all these wonderful things.
We have nothing. >> AMBER: I agree.
I'm totally for going. >> JERRI: I'm so stoked about
going to their camp. >> TINA: We've got mail!
>> JERRI: Is there chocolate in it?
>> TINA: No, ma'am. >> ELISABETH: Peanut butter in
that mailbox? >> TINA: "Once you were enemies
but now you'll be one. You have just 15 minutes to get
all your work done. Hike back to the croc swim.
The map shows you the way. Take all that you can, but the
canoe's got to stay." >> AMBER: Oh!
JERRI: In the black bag, you guys.
>> TINA: We're moving! >> JERRI: We were ready to pack
up and move to camp Kucha. Roll up the flag inside.
>> TINA: The other black glove? >> AMBER: Do we need our fishing
poles? >> JERRI: When we looked at the
map, it was a completely different spot.
>> AMBER: Maybe they're doing same thing, and we're going to
have a whole new camp. >> ELISABETH: I thought about
that. Yep, I think that's what it is.
>> JERRI: A spot that was untouched, where we would have
to build everything again from scratch.
>> NICK: "Hike back to the croc swim.
The map shows the way. Take all that you can, but the
canoe's got to stay." >> JEFF V.: It's a good two-hour
walk. Damn it. >> KEITH: Make sure you bring
your matches. Mine are... I got my matches.
Nothing's ever easy around here. >> RODGER: We were a little
angry about it. >> COLBY: Six minutes.
>> KEITH: I was really frustrated with it.
I just didn't want to leave there.
We were there, we were comfortable.
>> COLBY: I was liking that Kucha corn.
>> KEITH: Yeah, I'm liking our camp.
>> COLBY: Yeah, I was liking y'all's camp, too.
>> KEITH: It was a real pain. >> RODGER: Let's go.
>> ELISABETH: I see it, I see it!
>> Are you serious? ( women cheering and ululating )
>> ELISABETH: We missed you guys!
>> JEFF V.: Hey, baby. >> ELISABETH: How are you?
>> AMBER: Guys, check this out! Look!
Oh, my God, it's ours! ( indistinct conversations )
>> RODGER: They're doing all the work.
I'm glad. >> AMBER: You ready, guys?
>> JEFF V.: I'm thinking there might be food in here.
>> ALL: Oh! >> JEFF V: It looks like a
little picnic. ( everybody talking )
>> ALICIA: Okay. >> AMBER: "Building a new home
is now up to you, but before you get started, you
have two things to do. A flag must be made once your
tribe's named. Here's a toast to your efforts,
and the second half of the game!"
( everybody talking and laughing )
>> ALICIA: One, two, three. >> TINA: Wow!
We get to make a new flag. ( everybody squealing
and cheering ) >> NICK: We opened the box, and
people just start diving their hands in, which pissed me off,
because I was thinking let's at least make sure we're getting
equal amounts, but Jerri and Amber and Elisabeth and Alicia
just start yapping and screaming, and I was like, I had
to back up. >> ELISABETH: Oh, cheese,
cheese, cheese! >> TINA: I've never had wine in
my life, and I'm fixin' to have some.
( laughter ) I may get drunk.
>> Hey, guys, here's a tablecloth.
>> This is a party! >> JERRI: I swear, I haven't
been that excited since I was little, and so just completely
overwhelmed with the fact that you've been starving, and the
fact that you're in the middle of nowhere, and there's this
spread in front of you. >> ALL: Yeah!
( cheering ) >> TINA: It's nice starting all
over, starting on equal ground, and it was important to listen
more than you talk, find out what you're up against.
>> AMBER: Oh, you guys, this is so great!
>> ALICIA: You know, it was really kind of interesting,
because in the middle of all this celebrating, this game is
still being played, every minute of every day.
>> JERRI: My stomach's going what is going on?
>> ALICIA: I have a little bit of shock happening right now.
>> JEFF V.: They seem to be very nice, and I thought it was all
legitimate, and then I saw Colby and Jerri sort of sneak off and
whispering, and then I saw Colby walk over to Keith, and then
they start whispering, and they're, like, pointing at us
and counting fingers, like she's going to go first and he's going
to go second, and it started. We weren't together 15 minutes,
and it started. ( crickets chirping )
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa >> RODGER: Thank God it's not
raining... We need to get something up over
our heads here in case it rains tonight.
>> JERRI: Like, what's the purpose of putting it up here?
Like, the trees, the structure? >> RODGER: Just to have the
trees and the shade and the... >> ALICIA: We're gonna need a
big... >> JERRI: Well, you know what?
I have to... I'll just express my
opinion right now. >> RODGER: Okay.
>> JERRI: I think... >> Wow.
>> JERRI: On the beach right there in the shade.
( indistinct chatter ) >> RODGER: Let's-Let's go down
there and take... >> JERRI: All right, let's look.
Yay! ( indistinct chatter )
>> COLBY: Sometimes you run into a situation where there's too
many chiefs and not enough Indians, so I'm just going to
stand back. I don't want to ruffle any
feathers at this point. >> TINA: You don't think that if
it rains, it will rain-rain down this thing, do you?
>> RODGER: Uh, that... >> NICK: That was one of my
thoughts. >> RODGER: That-That was one of
my thoughts, too. >> TINA: But we're on this high
thing. >> NICK: Yeah.
>> TINA: And if it runs down, it'll run down over there, won't
it? >> RODGER: It's called a dry
creek bed. I don't know if it's always dry
or not. That's the question.
My idea was to originally build the, uh, hut up in the trees
where you got some good anchors, and then the girls said, they
would like to stay down on the sand 'cause it sleeps better.
>> Is that...? >> RODGER: Go down with it a
little bit. >> RODGER: Okay, go.
>> ALICIA: Hey, Jer? >> JERRI: Yeah.
>> ALICIA: What was that little big fish-- what was that?
>> JERRI: All right, you know what?
>> ELISABETH: Oh. >> Oh, yeah.
>> ALICIA: That would be a perfect name.
>> ELISABETH: What is that? >> RODGER: Barramundi.
>> ALICIA: Barramundi? >> JEFF V.: Barramundi.
>> Ooh, I like that fish. >> ALICIA: You...
That means, like, if you catch this fish, we'll be eating for
days. >> JERRI: We are called the
Barramundi tribe. It's a great name for our new
tribe, 'cause this is when things get slippery and
sneaky, and it's hard to catch people.
>> ELISABETH: It's the catch of the day.
We're quite a catch. >> KEITH: Good old honeymoon
stage is going to end quickly. We're going to have to go into
an immunity challenge, and it's going to be obvious that we're
kind of two teams living as one tribe.
>> JEFF: Welcome! I will take the immunity idol.
Barramundi, new tribe name. New tribe, new game.
No longer playing for tribal immunity, playing for individual
immunity. ( all responding )
>> JEFF: This is what you covet. Wear this, you're immune from
Tribal Council. You cannot be voted out.
Today's challenge is called "The Perch."
There are ten wooden pillars to stand on, one for each of you.
I'm going to warn you-- this could be a long one.
This challenge tests both your will and endurance.
Last one standing wins this, is immune from the vote tonight.
Keep your eye on the talisman! Immunity at stake.
Survivors ready... go! >> JERRI: Anybody want to look
up at the sky and see if the sun might peek out?
>> RODGER: I'm-I'm afraid to look.
>> ELISABETH: Rodger's, like, "I'm not looking."
>> RODGER: I am fixed on the woods up there, son.
I don't look down at the water. ( laughter )
If I did, I'd be a goner. >> JEFF V.: I'm going to try to
alphabetize the 50 states. >> RODGER: Well, that...
>> AMBER: Isn't there a song? >> RODGER: Arkansas.
>> JERRI: Alabama. >> ELISABETH: Boy, things sure
have gotten fun out here. ( laughter )
>> NICK: You guys, have a good game.
>> All right. >> ALICIA: Bye, baby.
>> Bye. >> Bye, Nick.
>> RODGER: Just don't get too close to me, Nick, 'cause I'm
liable to be next. >> NICK: I've been sick the last
couple days, and I got up there, felt a little dizzy, knew I
wasn't going to win, and jumped off, and got a good hour of rest
